title: Hosting a Kid’s Birthday Party Is Now a Social Minefield
sub_head: Parents are throwing normal birthday parties for their children again. But navigating the social etiquette around fast-changing Covid-19 comfort levels is tricky.
body:
The hardest part of planning a child’s birthday right now isn’t the venue, the unicorn-themed party favors or getting a dozen second-graders to wait for a cake. It is figuring out what makes other families comfortable.
When Cara Finn sent an invite for her 6-year-old’s birthday party last month, it had the tone of a note from the local health department. Guests invited to the arcade were informed that specific Covid-19 precautions would be announced closer to the event and based on case counts of that particular week.
